title: The Greek public healthcare system remains in shambles
subhead: The system suffers from chronic underfunding and staff shortages. Low salaries drive doctors to the private sector.

title: Bodies found in the Seine: Two criminal investigations deepen the mystery
subhead: Four bodies discovered near Pont de Choisy in a Paris suburb had not all been submerged at the same time. Examinations revealed signs of violence on two of them, prompting two murder investigations.

title: In 'Together', a codependent couple is put through the wringer of body horror
subhead: A surprising, playful and audacious debut that explores the dynamics of marriage and the torment of the attraction-repulsion cycle.

title: Henri Matisse and his heirs: The end of a financial windfall
subhead: Since Henri Matisse's death in 1954, four generations of his family have guarded his vast body of work jealously and with the utmost discretion. But when the painter's work entered the public domain in January, it ended the lucrative reproduction rights the heirs had enjoyed, as well as their oversight of everything concerning their ancestor.
byline: By Roxana Azimi and Clément Ghys

title: Near Los Angeles, a man struck and killed by SUV while fleeing ICE agents
China's robotics industry surges amid promise of a $5 trillion market

byline: By Vincent Fagot and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)

title: A winemaker, his daughter and a vintage for their undocumented workers
subhead: In southeastern France, Philippe Grisard and his daughter, Nadège, rely daily on undocumented workers to help tend their vineyard. To draw attention to their workers' precarious legal status, they named one of their vintages 'Sans eux' ('Without Them').

title: 'Who can stop masturbating the longest?': The day 'Seinfeld' tackled sexuality
subhead: 'Breaking the Script' (2/5). In November 1992, the sitcom's popularity soared when, in its fourth season, the four main characters, three men and a woman, made a bet on who could endure sexual abstinence the longest. This direct and funny approach to sexuality opened up new possibilities for television series. Spoiler alert!
